clinical_study.brief_title: Plan for Systematic Identification of Lung Cancers of Occupational Origin: Implementation Study

lead_sponsor.agency: Institut de Cancérologie de la Loire

collaborator.agency: Centre Hospitalier Universitaire de Saint Etienne

clinical_study.source: Institut de Cancérologie de la Loire

brief_summary.textblock:
The main objective is to identify obstacles and elements facilitating the implementation of a tracking device Broncho Pulmonary Cancer during the course of care.
The secondary objective is to assess patient knowledge and information received on their previous occupational exposure during their professional activity.
This is a prospective multicenter study of qualitative methodology through in-depth interviews conducted with patients treated at ICLN and CHU Saint-Etienne

primary_outcome.description: Obstacles and elements facilitating the establishment of a work-related bronchopulmonary cancer tracking device during the course of care. These are collected in an interview with a sociologist. It will be analyse with NVivo.

arm_group.description: The questionnaire is tracking occupational carcinogens. It consists of 30 questions , fills an average of 3 minutes and includes three response categories: "yes", "no" and "do not know". A questionnaire will be added social and professional issues. Interviews will be conducted with the patient to identify obstacles and facilitating elements
